AcademicEngagement.Description: We assist a professor by collecting data from different national dailies for writing his book manuscript.
Our team poses for a click in the midst of our field study tour arranged for Political Anthropology course.
Our group members with Professor Sakib after a successful poster presentation organized for Contemporary World Politics course. We secured the ‘best presenter’ title in this presentation.
I have presented my paper on the Webinar (Critical Thoughts on the Post-Pandemic World: With a Special Reference to Bangladesh) organized by IDEA Bangladesh.
While I was conducting FGD for End-line Study on Activating Village Courts in Bangladesh Funded by United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).
I worked as a RA with Professor Mahiuddin in his research project. This photo has been captured while we were conducting a KII for his study.
After the completion of a presentation on Bangladesh Constitution with our course instructor Mr. Kamruzzaman.
Me with my classmates while we visited a gypsy village as part of our Research Methodology course field work.

WorkshopAndSeminar.Description: I was presenting as a trainee leader at the “Active Citizens Youth Leadership Training, 2018”, organized by British Council and The Hunger Project Bangladesh.
Participated at a public speech organized by IDEA Bangladessh, a platform that teaches me to engage, speak and flourish.
That was the first time I had the experience to host an online event organized by IDEA Bangladesh.
All the organizing members of “Governance in the 21st Century in South Asia: Challenges and Ways Forward” held at Jahangirnagar University.
Attending a session at the “Social Accountability BootCamp 2020” jointly organized by Participatory Research Action Network- PRAN and ActionAid Bangladesh.

In the condemnation of massive attack on Hindus during 2021 Durga Puja in Bangladesh, we organized an open discussion on communal violence with the support of our department. Here is our keynote speaker Professor Naseem Akhter Hossain and one of our co-organizers and my fellow junior Mr. Jahidul Islam.

⁠In a group discussion during 7th Bangladesh School of Internet Governance. My participation as a “fellow” allowed me to gain invaluable experience from this 3-day-long school. The photo was taken while we were having a group discussion, and I was sharing my ideas at that time.

I constantly participated in a series of workshops, seminars, public lectures, and discussions during my university life. It was such a moment when Professor Ashir Ahmed, a renowned writer and teacher, came to our department and delivered his speech on “Digital Health I Society 5 I Artificial Intelligence.”

I was blessed to have the opportunity to be a facilitator and conduct sessions on “Disclosure of Public Interest Information (Protection) Act, 2011” in sixteen universities in Bangladesh. We arranged workshops on “University Students’ Attitudes on Whistleblowing: Awareness, Progress and Challenges of Implementation at the Public Sectors in Bangladesh” supported by the U.S. Department of State, Meridian International Center, and EMK Center.

I was presenting a case on behalf of our group at the “Strategic Advocacy Development Workshop: Strengthening Transparency and Accountability in Bangladesh” organized by the International Republican Institute (IRI).

CoCurricular.Description: As a member of my department team, I performed in the “Annual Cultural Competition 2021”, where we secured the runner-up position.
The finishing moment. After the completion of a successful football tournament.
Our team Itibritto, together we wrote, shot, and published content for our YouTube channel.
I dared to wear Plato’s costume on the stage. It was complete fun.
I had great learnings and photographic experience from the JUPS guy. On that day, I was entitled to a new role of Public Relations Secretary.

That was the moment when my classmates and teachers celebrated our last day of master’s class with a cake. I served as an elected class representative in my class for five consecutive years. It was hard for me to say goodbye.

Activism.Description: We organized a human chain to protect a historic tree in the heart of our hometown, Feni, Bangladesh. This tree holds significant cultural and historical value for the community. However, illegal activities have posed a threat to its existence. Our campaign carried the message: “Save the Trees, Save the Earth.” After that, we handed over a memorandum to the municipal authority to take necessary measures.
My friends and I organized a campus-wide campaign featuring wall posters to promote awareness and encourage women's safety in public spaces.

In 2018, a speeding bus in Dhaka killed two college students and injured nine, sparking massive student protests demanding safer roads. I actively joined protests organized by my campus. The movement led to the Road Transport Act 2018, a 17-point directive from the Prime Minister’s Office, and a nationwide Traffic Week to raise road safety awareness.

In 2016, Sohagi Jahan Tonu, a 19-year-old student of Comilla Victoria College, was tragically found dead in a secured military cantonment. Her suspected rape and murder ignited nationwide protests and outrage on social media. Along with my college friends, I organized a campus-wide demonstration demanding justice and an end to violence against women.
We demanded justice for a girl who was physically abused and killed in her academic institution. The human chain was organized by JUSAF, our district’s student forum, on the university campus.
"With a sovereign flag and stubborn mindset, we stand tall against a tyrant." This photo was taken on August 4, 2024, before the Hasina government was uprooted by a mass uprising.
